Articles.Content:
Hey guys, Sorry if this is an obvious question, but currently I am working on a rover that I would like to have a slanted cover over the top using metal plates under the "Structural" Tab. The closest i can get to is in 'angle snap mode, but it tilts around the plate's node wrong and I cannot get it to work the way I would like. I also have ideas like MaceyDean's (youtube) "Vulture" but these Ideas are impossible to achieve if I cannot get them to snap right. Does anyone have any pointers to how I can get it to snap in a way like the picture?

TL:DR -- I need help finding angle snaps on objects so that I can create a greater variety of ideas. Can anybody help me?
Mod + w,a,s,d,q,e rotate the object by 5 degrees, I believe. The key for Mod varies between Windows, Apple, and Linux, but on Windows it's Alt, if that's any help. Hope that answers your question

Shift actually, for rotating parts in VAB/SPH.

Edit: Holding Alt (if you're using windows) and clicking an item/group will copy it, handy to use with symmetry.
